text: The Industrial and Mining Water Research Unit (abbreviated IMWaRU) is a research group. They are part of the School of Chemical and Metallurgical Engineering at the University of the Witwatersrand, JohannesburgUniversity of the Witwatersrand, Johannesburg, School of Chemical and Metallurgical Engineering, Research Units: IMWaRU , retrieved 6 November 2014. and have been operating there since 2011. ==Unit Structure== The unit deals with many water based issues and problematic circumstances in industry and miningHarding, KG, 2014, Accounting for water use in the process industries, ChemTech, April 2014, p3, retrieved 14 November 2014. settings. ==Collaboration== The unit works with the Schools of Law, Chemistry, Civil and Mining engineering at the University.
